title: Chinese Orienteering Team Kicked Out Of The Military Games After ‘Extensive Cheating’
text:
Chinese Orienteering Team Kicked Out Of The Military Games After ‘Extensive Cheating’

Chinese Orienteering Team Kicked Out Of The Military Games After ‘Extensive Cheating’

Chinese orienteering team was kicked out of the Military Games in China after accusation of 'extensive games' from six European nations.

Xinhua

The Chinese had dominated the orienteering events in the week, having won gold, silver, and fourth place in the women's Middle Distance orienteering challenge, as well as silver in the men's event.

But their celebrations were short lived as the accusations of cheating gathered pace following their not so fair heroics in the orienteering events.

"The Middle Distance competition was unfortunately overshadowed by extensive cheating by the Chinese team," the International Orienteering Federation (IOF) said in a press release.

The federation also said it was "discovered and proven" that the Chinese team received illegal assistance from the spectators, who placed markings and prepared small paths in the terrain to help their team get an advantage over other teams.

The European teams of Russia, Switzerland, France, Belgium, Poland and Austria, had earlier submitted a formal complaint, and the jury disqualified everyone in the home orienteering team.

AFP

China filed an appeal against decision taken by the IOF, but it was outrightly rejected.

Athletes from Russia's military were then awarded gold in both the men's and women's event.
